sentences.en: "Does it sound like music?" — "I wouldn't go that far."
sentences.cn: “这听上去像音乐吗？”——“我可不那样认为。”

sentences.en: "What would you like to eat?" — "Anything'll do me, Eva."
sentences.cn: “你想吃什么？”——“我吃什么都行，伊娃。”

sentences.en: A club should be like a big family.
sentences.cn: 俱乐部就应该像一个大家庭。

sentences.en: Any head teacher who made errors like this would be chucked out.
sentences.cn: 哪个校长只要犯了这样的错误都会被开除。

sentences.en: Do you like this colour?
sentences.cn: 你喜欢这种颜色吗？

sentences.en: he believes the figure should be more like £10 million.
sentences.cn: 他认为应该是1,000万英镑才对。

sentences.en: He did not like to be caught out on details.
sentences.cn: 他不喜欢在细节上被人抓住把柄。

sentences.en: He eats like a pig!
sentences.cn: 他吃东西像猪一样！

sentences.en: He looked nothing like (= not at all like ) the man in the police photograph.
sentences.cn: 他看上去一点也不像警方照片上的那个人。

sentences.en: He once told an interviewer that he didn't even like rock music.
sentences.cn: 他曾告诉一位采访者，他甚至都不喜欢摇滚乐。

sentences.en: He was a huge man, built like an oak tree.
sentences.cn: 他是个大块头，结实得像棵橡树。

sentences.en: he'll have lost a deal of blood, I dare say, and like enough he's still losing it.
sentences.cn: 他会失很多血，我敢说他现在很可能还在流血。

sentences.en: He’s growing more like his father every day.
sentences.cn: 他一天比一天长得更像他的父亲。

sentences.en: He’s very like his brother.
sentences.cn: 他很像他的哥哥。

sentences.en: Heck, if you don't like it, don't vote for him.
sentences.cn: 如果你不喜欢，不要投他的票不就得了。

sentences.en: Her hair is dark brown like mine.
sentences.cn: 她的头发是深褐色的，和我的一样。

sentences.en: How do you like living in London (= how much do you like it )?
sentences.cn: 住在伦敦你感觉怎样？

sentences.en: I didn’t like the idea of being a single parent.
sentences.cn: 我可不想当单亲家长。

sentences.en: I don’t like it when you get angry.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢你生气时的样子。

sentences.en: I don't like the look of that head injury.
sentences.cn: 我觉得头部损伤的样子挺叫人担心的。

sentences.en: I don’t really like classical music.
sentences.cn: 我不是很喜欢古典音乐。

sentences.en: I like my coffee quite weak.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢喝很淡的咖啡。

sentences.en: I like your jacket.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢你这件上衣。

sentences.en: I quite like their new album.
sentences.cn: 我很喜欢他们的新专辑。

sentences.en: I thought you might like to read the enclosed.
sentences.cn: 我想你或许想要读一下信封里的内容。

sentences.en: If you'd like more information, ring the Hotline on 414 3929.
sentences.cn: 如果想了解更多信息，请拨打热线电话4143929。

sentences.en: it's a whole new branch of chemistry, a new science if you like.
sentences.cn: 这是化学的一个全新分支，甚至可以说是一门新科学。

sentences.en: like father, like son.
sentences.cn: 有其父必有其子。

sentences.en: Like their children, parents are often defensive about their private lives.
sentences.cn: 就像子女一样，父母也常常很注重保护他们的私生活。

sentences.en: My experience is very much like that described in the book.
sentences.cn: 我的经历很像这本书上说的那样。

sentences.en: she didn't want to associate with the likes of me.
sentences.cn: 她不愿和我这样的人打交道。

sentences.en: she would be in bed by now, like as not.
sentences.cn: 她现在很可能在床上了。

sentences.en: Show me which one you like and I'll buy it for you.
sentences.cn: 指给我看你喜欢哪个，我给你买。

sentences.en: Sometimes you sound just like (= exactly like ) my mum!
sentences.cn: 有时候你听上去简直就像我妈！

sentences.en: Teddy clucked his tongue like a disapproving English matron.
sentences.cn: 特迪咂了咂舌头，活像个不以为然的英国女舍监。

sentences.en: The time I like best (= like most of all ) is the evening when it’s cool.
sentences.cn: 我最喜欢的时间是凉爽的傍晚。

sentences.en: the votive candles are arranged like so.
sentences.cn: 供奉用的蜡烛应该这样摆。

sentences.en: they would probably worry like anything.
sentences.cn: 他们可能会担心死了。

sentences.en: This is more like a downpayment, or a deposit, if you like.
sentences.cn: 这更像是首付，也可以说是定金。

sentences.en: Three hundred million dollars will be nothing like enough.
sentences.cn: 3亿美元远远不够。

sentences.en: we could go riding if you like.
sentences.cn: 你要是愿意，我们就去骑马。

sentences.en: We really liked the film.
sentences.cn: 我们非常喜欢这部影片。

sentences.en: Why should a great community like a university be afraid of nihilism?
sentences.cn: 为什么像大学这样人才济济的社区要害怕虚无主义呢？

sentences.en: Would you like a drink?
sentences.cn: 你想喝一杯吗？

sentences.en: You have to fold the corners back, like so.
sentences.cn: 你得把角折回去，像这样。

sentences.en: you're celebrating with us, like it or not.
sentences.cn: 不管愿不愿意，你都要和我们一起庆祝。

words.tran_cn: 令人喜爱的，可爱的（等于likable）
很可能的；合适的；有希望的
相似，相像；样子，肖像；照片，画像；相似物

phrases.tran_cn: ［表示轻蔑的感叹 句］ 竟有人会说出这种话来！亏你（他）说得出口！
换句话说，也就是说，可以说
毫不费力地；轻而易举地；完美地
(非正式)十分，非常；在很大程度上
(非正式)［表示不容许某人有选择］不管怎样
喜欢做某事（特指某一次）
(非正式)更接近（某一数字或某种描述）

phrases.phrase: not like the look (或 sound) of

phrases.tran_cn: 没有什么能比得上；一点也不象

trans.tran_cn: 大概，（非正式口语）我说，（口语）嗯，像

trans.tran_en: the things that someone likes and does not like

trans.tran_cn: 喜好，类似的事物/人，种类
trans.tran_en: the things that someone likes and does not like
used when you are showing someone how to do something

trans.tran_cn: 像，怎么样，（是）…样的人/事物，比如，与…一样，
trans.tran_en: similar to something else, or happening in the same way
to enjoy something or think that it is nice or good
